001package Tools;
002
003import java.awt.Graphics2D;
004import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
005import java.io.File;
006import java.io.FileOutputStream;
007import java.io.IOException;
008
009import com.itextpdf.awt.PdfGraphics2D;
010import com.itextpdf.text.Document;
011import com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException;
012import com.itextpdf.text.Rectangle;
013import com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfContentByte;
014import com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfWriter;
015
016import ij.IJ;
017import ij.ImagePlus;
018import ij.gui.Overlay;
019import ij.gui.Roi;
020import ij.io.SaveDialog;
021import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
022import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
023
024
025/**
026 * This ImageJ plugin exports the current image and its attached
027 * vector graphic overlay (if existent) as a PDF file.
028 * This plugin requires iText to be in the Java library path:
029 * place itextpdf-5.5.8.jar (or newer) in {@code ImageJ/jars/}.
030 * iText releases can be downloaded from here:
031 * <a href="https://github.com/itext/itextpdf/releases">
032 * https://github.com/itext/itextpdf/releases</a>.
033 * 
034 * @author W. Burger
035 * @version 2016/01/09
036 */
037public class Export_PDF_With_Overlay implements PlugInFilter {
038
039        /**
040         * Used to draw graphic strokes with zero stroke width.
041         */
042        public static double DefaultStrokeWidth = 0.01;         // substitute for zero-width strokes
043        
044        /**
045         * Set true to have a default ICC profile (sRGB) added
046         * to the PDF file. Solves problems with viewing
047         * files in Acrobat X+.
048         */
049        public static boolean AddIccProfile = true;
050        
051        public static String DefaultFileExtension = ".pdf";
052        
053        private static String CurrentOutputDirectory = IJ.getDirectory("home");
054        private ImagePlus img;
055
056        public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus img) {
057                this.img = img;
058                return DOES_ALL + NO_CHANGES;
059        }
060
061        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
062                if (!verifyIText()) {
063                        IJ.error("This plugin requires iText to be installed!\n" +
064                                        "Download itextpdf-5.5.8.jar (or newer) from\n" +
065                                        "https://github.com/itext/itextpdf/releases\n" +
066                                        "and place in ImageJ/jars/");
067                        return;
068                }
069                
070                if (img.getStackSize() != 1) {
071                        IJ.error("Can only export single images (no stacks)!");
072                        return;
073                }
074                
075                String dir = IJ.getDirectory("image");
076                if (dir == null) 
077                        dir = CurrentOutputDirectory;
078                
079                String name = stripFileExtension(img.getTitle());
080                        
081                String path = askForFilePath(dir, name, "Save as PDF");
082                if (path == null) {
083                        return;
084                }
085                
086                String finalPath = createPdf(img, path);
087                if (finalPath == null) 
088                        IJ.log("PDF export failed");
089                else
090                        IJ.log("PDF exported to " + finalPath);
091        }
092        
093        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
094        
095        /** Saves a PDF of the supplied image.
096         * 
097         * @param im the image (of type {@link ij.ImagePlus}), possibly with attached vector overlay
098         * @param path the path to save to
099         * @return the complete path to the created PDF file or {@code null} 
100         * if the file could not be saved
101         */
102        public String createPdf(ImagePlus im, String path) {
103                final int width  = im.getWidth();
104                final int height = im.getHeight();
105                
106                // step 1: create the PDF document
107                Document document = new Document(new Rectangle(width, height));
108                try {
109                        // step 2: create a PDF writer
110                        PdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document,      new FileOutputStream(path));
111                        // step 3: open the document
112                        document.open();
113                        // step 4: create a template and the associated Graphics2D context
114                        PdfContentByte cb = writer.getDirectContent();
115                        
116                        // optional: set sRGB default viewing profile
117                        if (AddIccProfile) {
118                                byte[] iccdata = java.awt.color.ICC_Profile.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_sRGB).getData();  
119                                com.itextpdf.text.pdf.ICC_Profile icc = com.itextpdf.text.pdf.ICC_Profile.getInstance(iccdata);
120                                writer.setOutputIntents("Custom", null, "http://www.color.org", "sRGB IEC61966-2.1", icc);
121                        }
122                                                
123                        // insert the image
124                        com.itextpdf.text.Image pdfImg = com.itextpdf.text.Image.getInstance(im.getImage(), null);
125                        pdfImg.setAbsolutePosition(0, 0);
126                        pdfImg.scaleToFit(width, height);               
127                        cb.addImage(pdfImg);
128                        
129                        // optional: draw the vector overlay
130                        Overlay overlay = im.getOverlay();
131                        if (overlay != null) {
132                                Graphics2D g2 = new PdfGraphics2D(cb, width, height);
133                                Roi[] roiArr = overlay.toArray();
134                                for (Roi roi : roiArr) {
135                                        float sw = roi.getStrokeWidth();
136                                        if (sw < 0.001f) {      // sometimes stroke width is simply not set (= 0)
137                                                roi.setStrokeWidth(DefaultStrokeWidth); // temporarily change stroke width
138                                        }
139                                        ImagePlus tmpIm = roi.getImage();
140                                        roi.setImage(null);     // trick learned from Wayne to ensure magnification is 1
141                                        roi.drawOverlay(g2);    // replacement (recomm. by Wayne)
142                                        roi.setImage(tmpIm);
143                                        roi.setStrokeWidth(sw); // restore original stroke width
144                                }
145                                g2.dispose();
146                        }
147                        
148                } catch (DocumentException de) {
149                        IJ.log(de.getMessage());
150                } catch (IOException ioe) {
151                        IJ.log(ioe.getMessage());
152                }
153 
154                // step 5: close the document
155                document.close();
156                return path;
157        }
158        
159        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
160        
161    private String askForFilePath(String dir, String name, String title) {
162        String extension = DefaultFileExtension;
163        SaveDialog od = new SaveDialog(title, dir, name, extension);
164        dir  = od.getDirectory();
165        name = od.getFileName();
166        if(name != null) {
167                CurrentOutputDirectory = dir;
168                return new File(dir, name).getAbsolutePath();
169        }
170        else
171                return null;
172    }
173        
174        private String stripFileExtension(String fileName) {
175                int dotInd = fileName.lastIndexOf('.');
176                // if dot is in the first position,
177                // we are dealing with a hidden file rather than an DefaultFileExtension
178                return (dotInd > 0) ? fileName.substring(0, dotInd) : fileName;
179        }
180        
181        
182        private boolean verifyIText() {
183                try {
184                        if (Class.forName("com.itextpdf.text.Document") != null) {
185                                return true;
186                        }
187                } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) { }
188                return false;
189        }
190}
191
